page.title: 02UPLAWMOOR VILLAGE
page.content: Uplawmoor is a quiet,friendly,rural commuter village of approximately 670 inhabitants. It has a primary school,an inn,a small general store with a post office and the old school building is now the library and youth club.There is also a large community hall,the Mure Hall. Its one park has a football pitch, six swings and a slide.Next to it is the tennis pavilion with three adjacent tennis courts. In the centre of the village is the church. At the north end of the village are the woods with old mineshafts while south of the village is the glen with its lovely waterfall. There are four bus-stops but very few buses. There is always lots to do.
